net.sf.mmm.util.validation.base

Class ValidationStateMessageCollector

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.mmm.util.validation.base.AbstractValidationStateCollector
      • net.sf.mmm.util.validation.base.ValidationStateMessageCollector
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ValidationCollector, ValidationState

    public class ValidationStateMessageCollector
extends AbstractValidationStateCollector
    This is an implementation of ValidationState that wraps an existing ValidationState and allows to collect the potential messages for a part of the validation process.
    Example:
     public boolean validate(ValidationState state) {

   if (state == null) {
     state = new ValidationStateImpl();
   }

   ValidationStateMessageCollector messageCollector = new ValidationStateMessageCollector(state);
   validateRecursive(messageCollector);
   String messages = messageCollector.getFailureMessages();
   if (messages != null) {
     setTooltip(messages);
     setStyle("invalid");
   } else {
     setTooltip("");
     setStyle("valid");
   }
   return messageCollector.isValid();
 }
    Since:
    3.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid()
        This method determines if the validation has been successful.
        ATTENTION:
        This method only returns false if a ValidationFailure has been collected by this instance. It may therefore return true even if the delegate would return false.
        Specified by:
        isValid in interface ValidationState
        Overrides:
        isValid in class AbstractValidationStateCollector
        Returns:
        true if no ValidationFailure has been collected, false otherwise.
